bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank R. McCoy, November 10, 1949

div1.p: Hench writes that he is looking forward to examining Leonard Wood's diaries.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank R. McCoy, November 10, 1949
div1.opener:
Y F
November 10, 1949
Major General and Mrs. Frank R. McCoy
1633 31st Street, N. W.
Washington 7, D. C.
My dear General and Mrs. McCoy:
div1.p:
I have just returned from two weeks trip down cast to find some
most interesting news from General Kean. He tells me that you have
probably arranged for Miss Luicita Wood to review her father's data and
perhaps to make available for me early in January the diaries for 1900 and
1901.

I cannot tell you how much I appreciate this and if I hear that
the diaries will be available, I will plan to spend an extra day in Washington.
I am to speak at Walter Reed Hospital on January 4 and in New York on
January 5, but can return to Washington enroute home.

I realize that Miss Wood is not well and that “There is many a
slip....” Nevertheless, for your kind interest in my hobby, my sincere
thanks.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
